definition: old road/old way/old course (of a river)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Following the imperial road leisurely, the drum-tower seems deserted yet the bell still sounds.
sentences.chinese: 沿着帝王故道慢慢走來，鼓樓蒼然，鐘聲依舊。

sentences.english: The old river course has been filled up and remade into a driveway.
sentences.chinese: 河流的故道已經被填平，修成公路了。

sentences.english: Also the incidence in the former Yellow River vally was high.
sentences.chinese: 黃河故道一帶也是發病率較高的地區。

sentences.english: City is located in the deep basin Heilonggang Hutuo OXBOW for the alluvial plain.
sentences.chinese: 深州市地處黑龍港流域滹沱河故道，爲沖積平原。

definition: Ji River, former river of north-eastern China which disappeared after the Yellow River flooded in 1852
Wei River in Shaanxi through the Guanzhong 關中|关中[Guan1 zhong1] plain
Wei River in Shaanxi through the Guanzhong 關中|关中 plain
Huai River, main river of east China, between the Yellow River 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2] and the Changjiang 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1]
big/stream or canal/drain/ditch/CL:條|条[tiao2]/him (dialect)/outer rim of a carriage wheel (old)
name of several rivers/North Luo river, tributary of Wei river 渭河|渭河[Wei4 He2] in Shaanxi
